alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Bexar; Comal; Gillespie; Kendall; Kerr; Medina; Real (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 4:19PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Medina, Bandera, Kerr, Gillespie, Kendall, northwestern Bexar, eastern Real and western Comal Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 418 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms across this region. Movement is slow towards the south-southeast with these storms but also could be erratic at times. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Antonio, Medina, Schertz, Kerrville, Universal City, Live Oak, Boerne, Fredericksburg, Selma, Comfort, Bandera, Leakey, Tarpley, Vanderpool, San Antonio Int Airport, Canyon Lake, Helotes, Fair Oaks Ranch, Bulverde and Garden Ridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
